NAME: DCP MIDSTREAM, LP
ACCIDENT_DETAILS: NOTIFICATION FROM OTHER PIPELINE OPERATOR WHO MONITORS STATION.
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
RELEASE_TYPE_DETAILS: FAILURE OF 6" DEADLEG PIPE DUE TO INTERNAL CORROSION.
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: DEAD LEG OF PIPE THAT IS APPROXIMATELY 20FT IN LENGTH.
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: ON JANUARY 30, 2024, AT APPROXIMATELY 9:15PM A FAILURE OCCURRED ON THE 6" DEAD LEG OFF THE SOUTHEAST 24" TIE-IN POINT. OVERHEAD POWER LINES IGNITED THE GAS. NORTHERN NATURAL GAS NOTIFIED P66 PERSONNEL OF A LOSS OF PRESSURE AT THE BEAVER COMPRESSOR STATION WHICH AIDED US IN LOCATING THE INCIDENT QUICKLY.  LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS RESPONDED TO MONITOR THE SITUATION AND EXTINGUISH ASSOCIATED GRASS FIRES IN THE VICINITY AND TO CLOSE NS1540 ROAD. ALL COMPRESSION WAS SHUT DOWN AND VALVES WERE ISOLATED BY 10:32PM AND THE FIRE SELF-EXTINGUISHED AS PIPELINE PRESSURE DIMINISHED. THE FIRE WAS COMPLETELY EXTINGUISHED BY 2:20AM ON JANUARY 31. THE AFFECTED SEGMENT WAS ISOLATED AT THE 24" RECEIVER (2 VALVES) AND VALVE 2 UNDERGROUND VALVE. THE ISOLATED SEGMENT INCLUDED THE 6" FAILED SECTION AND APPROXIMATELY 15 MILES OF THE SOUTHEAST 24" PIPELINE.

NAME: HILAND PARTNERS HOLDINGS LLC
SYSTEM_PART_INVOLVED: ONSHORE COMPRESSOR STATION EQUIPMENT AND PIPING
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE OPERATOR DID NOT FIND THAT AN INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTROLLER(S) ACTIONS OR CONTROL ROOM ISSUES WAS NECESSARY DUE TO: (PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION FOR WHY THE OPERATOR DID NOT INVESTIGATE)
INVESTIGATION_STATUS_DETAILS: AN INVESTIGATION WAS DEEMED NOT NECESSARY SINCE THE CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT WAS DUE TO A MECHANICAL FAILURE OF THE THIRD STAGE SCRUBBER HIGH PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS.
CAUSE_DETAILS: FAILURE OF EQUIPMENT BODY (EXCEPT COMPRESSOR), VESSEL PLATE, OR OTHER MATERIAL
EQ_FAILURE_TYPE: FAILURE OF EQUIPMENT BODY (EXCEPT COMPRESSOR), VESSEL PLATE, OR OTHER MATERIAL
NARRATIVE: ON 01/28/2024 AT 2:58 PM LOCAL INCIDENT TIME, HILAND PERSONNEL HEARD A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE COMPRESSOR BUILDING.  A TECHNICIAN OBSERVED SMOKE COMING FROM THE BUILDING IN THE VICINITY OF COMPRESSOR UNIT #1, UNIT #1 IS A RENTAL UNIT FROM AXIP.  THE TECHNICIAN IMMEDIATELY ACTIVATED THE EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN (ESD) SYSTEM TO EVACUATE GAS FROM THE COMPRESSOR STATION.  BOTH THE OPERATIONS TECHNICIAN AND SPECIALIST THAT WERE ONSITE CONFIRMED AN ACTIVE FIRE AND AFTER ACTIVATING THE ESD MOVED TO THE FACILITY MUSTER POINT.  FIXED GAS DETECTION INSIDE THE BUILDING DETECTED THE SPIKE IN GAS CONCENTRATION HOWEVER THE TECHNICIAN HAD ALREADY ACTIVATED THE STATION ESD. THE ENSUING INVESTIGATION HAS DETERMINED THAT A 1/2" PENBERTHY GAUGE COCK THAT WAS SCREWED INTO A 3/4" THREADED CONNECTION IN THE SIDE OF THE THIRD STAGE COMPRESSOR SCRUBBER BOTTLE FAILED RELEASING FLAMMABLE GASES INTO THE BUILDING AND FINDING AN UNKNOWN IGNITION SOURCE.

NARRATIVE: ON 1/22/2024, THE ONEOK RIVERSIDE COMPRESSOR STATION EXPERIENCED AN EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN DUE TO GAS DETECTION WITHIN THE COMPRESSOR STATION BUILDING.  AS RESULTS OF PIPING CONFIGURATION, SEVERE AMBIENT CONDITIONS (ACTUAL TEMPERATURE -30ยบ F FOR A WEEK PRIOR TO THE EVENT), AND OPERATING CONDITIONS, IT IS ASSUMED THE RECYCLE LINE DEVELOPED A BLOCKAGE OF ICE OR HYDRATE UPSTREAM OF THE CONTROL LOOP BASED ON THE DATA COLLECTED AND ANALYZED. THERE IS A LACK OF EVIDENCE TO COLLECT DUE TO THE PHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF ICE OR A HYDRATE.

NARRATIVE: ON JANUARY 2, 2024, AT APPROXIMATELY 0900, A RUPTURE OCCURRED ON THE TRUNK O NM-24-24S-36E LOCATED 2.39 MILES NORTHWEST OF JAL, NEW MEXICO.  THE CONTROL CENTER NOTIFIED OPERATIONS AND AT APPROXIMATELY 1100 THE PIPELINE WAS BLOCKED AND ISOLATED BY OPERATIONS.    ONCE ONSITE, OPERATIONS CONFIRMED THE PIPELINE HAD RUPTURED.  AN ESTIMATED 8.3 MMCF OF NATURAL GAS WAS RELEASED.    THE JAL PLANT HAD PERIODIC OUTAGES THUS CAUSING THE PIPELINE TO OVER PRESSURE.    AT 1530 MST, RECEIVED GAS LOSS CALCULATIONS NOTIFIED NRC AT 1613 MST.    THE CAUSE OF THE RUPTURE IS STILL UNDER INVESTIGATION.    THE RUPTURED PORTION OF THE PIPE WAS CUT OUT AND SENT TO ADV INTEGRITY LAB FOR ANALYSIS AND WILL BE REPLACED WITH A 20 INCH PLASTIC PIPE.    A SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT WILL BE SUBMITTED ONCE THE INVESTIGATION IS COMPLETE, AND THE RESULTS ARE IN FROM THE LAB.

NAME: TARGA RESOURCES OPERATING LLC
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: AT APPROXIMATELY 12:45 PM TARGA OPERATIONS WERE NOTIFIED OF A POTENTIAL PIPELINE LEAK. PIPELINE OPERATION PERSONNEL IMMEDIATELY DISPATCHED TO THE SITE ARRIVING AROUND 1:30 PM. THE LEAK WAS FOUND AND CONFIRMED ON A TARGA PIPELINE AT 2:00 PM. OPERATION PERSONNEL BEGAN THE PROCESS OF ISOLATING THE PIPELINE BY CLOSING 2 MAINLINE VALVES AND 1 GAS METER VALVE TO ISOLATE THE LEAK. THE BLOCK VALVES WERE CLOSED AND THE LEAK WAS ISOLATED AT 4:30 PM. ONCE THE LEAK WAS ISOLATED VALVES WERE OPEN TO ATMOSPHERE AT EACH BLOCK VALVE LOCATION SO THAT THE PIPELINE COULD BE DEPRESSURIZED BEFORE REMEDIATION EFFORTS COULD BEGIN. ONCE THE AREA WAS DEEMED SAFE, REMEDIATION EFFORTS BEGAN UTILIZING A VACUUM TRUCK TO DISPOSE OF STANDING LIQUID IN THE LEAK AREA. THE LEAK OCCURRED ON A "FUTURE HOT TAP" FITTING INSTALLED IN THE PIPELINE. THIS FITTING IS A SHORT STEEL SEGMENT INSTALLED BETWEEN 2 SECTIONS OF POLYETHYLENE PIPELINE AND INCLUDED A 3 INCH LINE COMING OUT OF THE BOTTOM OF THE PIPE AND A 12 INCH "T" COMING FROM THE TOP OF THE PIPE WITH BOTH TERMINATING ABOVE GROUND. THE 3 INCH SERVED AS AN ADDITIONAL BLOWDOWN POINT ON THE PIPELINE AND THE 12 INCH COULD BE UTILIZED TO INSTALL FUTURE PIPELINE TIE-INS VIA HOT TAPPING. IN ORDER TO PREVENT AND MITIGATE RECURRENCE TARGA IS IN THE PROCESS OF REMOVING ALL SUCH FITTINGS THAT ARE FOUND TO BE INSTALLED IN THE GATHERING SYSTEM AND WILL NOT BE INSTALLED ON ANY NEW PIPELINES. ADDITIONALLY, TARGA UTILIZES AERIAL PATROL SURVEYS TO MITIGATE THE MAGNITUDE OF LEAKS BY DETECTING THEM EARLIER.

THE L-1 IS A TYPE R GATHERING LINE.  UPON LOSS AND UNACCOUNTABLE RECORDS REVIEW IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE GAS/LOSS IN THE SYSTEMS HAD STARTED ON 12/14/2023 AT APPROXIMATELY 1:00 PM. GAS/LOSS WAS CALCULATED ON 12/18/2023 AT 10:16 AND DEEMED REPORTABLE. NOTIFICATIONS WERE MADE PROMPTLY AFTERWARDS.

NARRATIVE: OPERATOR EMPLOYEE AND CONTRACTOR WERE PERFORMING PLANNED MAINTENANCE ON A COMPRESSOR WHEN GAS CONTAINMENT WAS LOST. A HIGH-LEVEL SHUTDOWN SWITCH WAS MISDIAGNOSED AS MALFUNCTIONING BUT WAS FUNCTIONING CORRECTLY. THE REMOVAL OF THE SWITCH ALLOWED FOR THE INTRODUCTION OF EXPLOSIVE VAPORS INSIDE THE COMPRESSOR BUILDING. A FLASH FIRE OCCURRED INSIDE THE BUILDING RESULTING IN ONE IN-PATIENT HOSPITALIZATION. ESTIMATED REPAIRS FOR THE BUILDING DUE TO THE ASSOCIATED FIRE IS APPROXIMATELY $2,000,000.

OSF_OTHER_DETAILS: A THIRD PARTY FORKLIFT HAD GOTTEN STUCK IN THE MUD ON PIPELINE RIGHT OF WAY AND TRIED TO UTILIZE THE FORK AND BOOM TO GET UNSTUCK.
NARRATIVE: A CONTRACTOR  PUNCTURED AN ACTIVE PIPELINE, CN-1053 MABEE 24 WHILE TRYING TO REMOVE   A STUCK FORKLIFT. THE FORKLIFT FORKS WERE PUSHED INTO THE GROUND AND BACKED UP, CAUSING THEM TO PUNCTURE THE PIPELINE. CN-1053 IS USED FOR GATHERING AND IS PART OF THE MAINLINE SYSTEM. IT IS A POLYLINE WITH A DIAMETER OF 10.75 INCHES AND HAS A MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE OPERATING PRESSURE OF 75 PSI. IT WAS INSTALLED ON MAY 15, 2014, AND PUT INTO SERVICE ON AUGUST 5, 2014. NO INJURIES OR FIRES OCCURRED DUE TO THE INCIDENT.

INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE OPERATOR DID NOT FIND THAT AN INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTROLLER(S) ACTIONS OR CONTROL ROOM ISSUES WAS NECESSARY DUE TO: (PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION FOR WHY THE OPERATOR DID NOT INVESTIGATE)
INVESTIGATION_STATUS_DETAILS: THE OPERATOR WAS ON-SITE AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.
EQ_ADDITIONAL_OTHER_DETAILS: THE HYDRATE BECAME MOBILIZED DUE TO A PRESSURE DIFFERENTIAL ACROSS THE BLOCKAGE.
AUTHORIZER_TITLE: DIRECTOR OF REGULATORY AFFAIRS AND COMPLIANCE
NARRATIVE: ON OCTOBER 30, 2023, AT APPROXIMATELY 6:05 P.M. MOUNTAIN TIME (MT), A NATURAL GAS RELEASE AND FIRE OCCURRED AT THE LARIAT COMPRESSOR STATION LOCATED IN LEA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO. THE FIRE CAUSED DAMAGE TO TWO (2) COMPRESSORS AND TWO (2) COMPANY VEHICLES ON-SITE. THERE WAS NO PROPERTY DAMAGE EXTENDING FURTHER THAN THE PERIMETER OF THE COMPRESSOR STATION. THERE WAS NO EVACUATION ORDER IMPACTING MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT. THE OPERATOR'S ROOT CAUSE INVESTIGATION DETERMINED A HYDRATE FORMED IN THE COMPRESSOR DISCHARGE PIPING DURING A PERIOD OF DOWNTIME IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT.  THE HYDRATE BECAME MOBILIZED DUE TO A PRESSURE DIFFERENTIAL ACROSS THE BLOCKAGE.  THE HYDRATE RELEASED TOWARD THE UNIT AND PERSONNEL, DAMAGING A FLANGE CONNECTION ON THE UNIT WHICH RESULTED IN A GAS RELEASE, IGNITION, AND FIRE.  THE PRESSURE DIFFERENTIAL WAS MOST LIKELY CREATED BY LEAKAGE ACROSS CHECK VALVES WHEN THE UNIT WAS IDLE FOLLOWING A PREVIOUS STARTUP ATTEMPT.

(ADDED REPAIR TIME BASED ON PHMSA COMMENT) EXCAVATION AND REPAIR DETERMINED TWO PINHOLE LEAKS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY RESULTING IN REPORTABLE VOLUME OF GAS RELEASE BEING CALCULATED. NAME: EASTERN GAS TRANSMISSION AND STORAGE, INC.
ACCIDENT_IDENTIFIER: SCADA-BASED INFORMATION (SUCH AS ALARM(S), ALERT(S), EVENT(S), AND/OR VOLUME OR PACK CALCULATIONS)
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: NO LAUNCHER/RECEIVER INSTALLED AT SLAUGHTERS CREEK M&R.
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE OPERATOR DID NOT FIND THAT AN INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTROLLER(S) ACTIONS OR CONTROL ROOM ISSUES WAS NECESSARY DUE TO: (PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION FOR WHY THE OPERATOR DID NOT INVESTIGATE)
INVESTIGATION_STATUS_DETAILS: AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT, THE AREA WAS EXPERIENCING SEVERE FLASH FLOODING AND A STATE OF EMERGENCY WAS DECLARED FOR KANAWHA COUNTY BY THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA. CONTROLLER ACTIONS OR CONTROL ROOM ISSUES WERE NOT THE CAUSE OF OR A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR TO THE INCIDENT.
NARRATIVE: THE RESPONSE TO THIS INCIDENT WAS COMPLICATED BY THE PREVAILING WEATHER CONDITIONS. AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT, KANAWHA COUNTY WAS EXPERIENCING SEVERE FLASH FLOODING SPECIFICALLY IN AREAS NEAR SLAUGHTERS CREEK AND A STATE OF EMERGENCY WAS DECLARED BY THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA ON 8/28/23. GAS CONTROL RECEIVED INITIAL NOTIFICATION OF THIS INCIDENT ON 8/28/23 AT APPROXIMATELY 08:00 BASED ON A PRESSURE DROP AT CORNWELL COMPRESSOR STATION (WHICH IS UPSTREAM OF WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263) AS INDICATED BY THE SCADA SYSTEM. GAS CONTROL HAD EARLIER BEEN NOTIFIED BY DIVERSIFIED ENERGY AT APPROXIMATELY 06:30 THAT A PIPELINE OPERATED BY DIVERSIFIED ENERGY THAT IS CONNECTED TO TL-263 AT SLAUGHTERS CREEK M&R (WHICH IS LOCATED IN PROXIMITY TO SLAUGHTERS CREEK) HAD ALSO EXPERIENCED A PRESSURE DROP AND IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT THE PIPELINE OPERATED BY DIVERSIFIED ENERGY EXPERIENCED A FULL GUILLOTINE BREAK AS A RESULT OF THE SEVERE FLASH FLOODING. THAT FULL GUILLOTINE BREAK OCCURRED AT A POINT IN TIME BEFORE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263. TL-263 IS A TYPE R (REGULATORY REPORTING) GATHERING PIPELINE AND HAS A MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE OPERATING PRESSURE OF 274 PSIG. AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT, THE OPERATING PRESSURE ON TL-263 WAS 240 PSIG AND TL-263 WAS FLOWING GAS. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL WERE PREVENTED BY LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS FROM BEING ABLE TO ACCESS CERTAIN ABOVEGROUND FACILITIES (INCLUDING SLAUGHTERS CREEK M&R) ASSOCIATED WITH TL-263 BECAUSE OF THE SEVERE FLASH FLOODING. WHEN IT WAS SAFE TO DO SO, OPERATIONS PERSONNEL BEGAN ISOLATING THE SECTION OF TL-263 CONTAINING SLAUGHTERS CREEK M&R. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL MANUALLY CLOSED VALVE N AT CHELYAN COMPRESSOR STATION AT APPROXIMATELY 10:15 WHICH IS UPSTREAM OF WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263 AND CONNECTS TL-263 TO TL-570. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL MANUALLY CLOSED VALVE D AT LOUP CREEK COMPRESSOR STATION AT APPROXIMATELY 11:00 AM WHICH IS DOWNSTREAM OF WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263 AND DOWNSTREAM OF THE FEED ON TL-263 FROM EASTERN AMERICAN ENERGY AT EASTERN AMERICAN GATE. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL ARRIVED AT THE SITE WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263 AT APPROXIMATELY 15:00 AT WHICH POINT IT WAS REALIZED THAT TL-263 HAD SUFFERED A FULL GUILLOTINE BREAK AT THE ABOVEGROUND CROSSING OF SLAUGHTERS CREEK. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THIS WAS CAUSED BY FLOATING DEBRIS THAT WAS ADRIFT AS A RESULT OF THE SEVERE FLASH FLOODING. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL MANUALLY CLOSED VALVE A AT THE WHITE OAKS RECEIVER AT APPROXIMATELY 17:00 WHICH IS DOWNSTREAM OF WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263 AND UPSTREAM OF VALVE D AT LOUP CREEK COMPRESSOR STATION AND THE FEED ON TL-263 FROM EASTERN AMERICAN ENERGY AT EASTERN AMERICAN GATE. THE CLOSURE OF VALVE A AT THE WHITE OAKS RECEIVER COMPLETED THE ISOLATION OF THE SECTION OF TL-263 CONTAINING THE INCIDENT. INITIAL TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATION WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON 8/28/23 AT 20:49. THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ASSIGNED INCIDENT REPORT #1377546 TO THE INITIAL NOTIFICATION OF THE INCIDENT. A FOLLOW UP TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATION WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON 8/30/23 AT 17:30 TO CONFIRM THE INITIAL TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATION AND UPDATE THE VOLUME OF UNINTENTIONAL GAS LOSS. THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ASSIGNED INCIDENT REPORT #1377726 TO THE FOLLOW UP TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATION. THE FOLLOWING REMEDIAL ACTIONS WERE COMPLETED: THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF TL-263 WAS PATROLLED VIA HELICOPTER WHEN WEATHER CONDITIONS ALLOWED ON 8/30/23, THE SECTION OF TL-263 WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED WAS CAPPED OFF, AND FLOW WAS RESUMED ON TL-263 VIA THE CONNECTION BETWEEN TL-263 AND TL-570 AT BLACK EAGLE JUNCTION WHICH IS DOWNSTREAM OF WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON TL-263 BUT UPSTREAM OF VALVE A AT THE WHITE OAKS RECEIVER. FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE REMEDIAL ACTIONS, TL-263 WAS RETURNED TO SERVICE ON 9/15/23 AT 05:48.

PART A, QUESTION A20A - PIPELINE WAS REPAIRED AND RETURNED TO SERVICE PROMPTLY UPON RELEASE DISCOVERY. SOIL REMEDIATION REQUIRED REPEATED ROUNDS OF EXCAVATION AND SAMPLING TO DELINEATE AND COMPLETE THE REMEDIATION EFFORT. COSTS OF REMEDIATION ARE NOT KNOWN UNTIL EXTENT OF SOIL REMOVAL IS DETERMINED AND STATE AGENCIES APPROVE SOIL SAMPLE ANALYSES FOR PROJECT CLOSEOUT.

NAME: ENERGY TRANSFER COMPANY
ACCIDENT_IDENTIFIER: NOTIFICATION FROM THIRD PARTY THAT CAUSED THE INCIDENT
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: NO LAUNCHER OR RECEIVER
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: ON 5/26/2023 AT APPROXIMATELY 8:30AM, TRIANGLE TRUCK DRIVER NOTICED GAS SMELL WHILE DRIVING HIS PIPELINE DRIP ROUTE. AS HE CONTINUED TO DRIVE, THE ENGINE BEGAN TO OVER REV. REALIZING WHAT WAS HAPPENING, HE EXITED TRUCK, AND MOVED TO A SAFE AREA. THE GAS IGNITED CAUSING A FIRE. THE TRUCK DRIVER NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR, WHO THEN CONTACTED ENERGY TRANSFER OPERATIONS MANAGER TO NOTIFY HIM OF THE EVENT. THE THIRD PARTY ALSO CONTACTED THE FIRE DEPARTMENT. THE ENERGY TRANSFER OPERATIONS MANAGER NOTIFIED FIELD OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR TO INVESTIGATE THE EVENT AT APPROXIMATELY 8:42AM. THE PIPELINE IS IN A COMMON PIPELINE CORRIDOR, AND IN AN AREA WHERE ENERGY TRANSFER HAS LEASED PIPELINES. ALTHOUGH THE PIPELINE OWNERSHIP WAS UNKNOWN, ENERGY TRANSFER FIELD OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR CONTACTED FIELD PERSONNEL TO START SHUTTING IN THE 909 STINNETT 24' AT 8:43AM. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED ON SCENE AT APPROXIMATELY 9:02AM. OPERATIONS PERSONNEL CLOSED THE PIPELINE VALVES MANUALLY, THE DOWNSTREAM VALVE AT 9:30AM AND THE UPSTREAM VALVE AT 9:45AM. AT APPROXIMATELY 11:00AM OPERATIONS DETERMINED THE PIPELINE WAS AN ENERGY TRANSFER ASSET. THE NRC WAS NOTIFIED AT 11:06AM. THE FIRE BURNED OUT AT APPROXIMATELY 1:20PM.   AFTER A MULTITUDE OF WEATHER DELAYS, REPAIRS ON THE 909 STINNETT 24' WERE COMPLETED ON JUNE 28, 2023. THE REPAIR CONSISTED OF A PIPE REPLACEMENT WITH (SDR) ELEVEN POLY PIPE. OPERATIONS PLACED THE PIPELINE BACK INTO SERVICE ON JULY 6, 2023. THE PIPELINE HAD ASPHALT COATING WITH NO INDICATIONS OF DISBONDING. THE WALL THICKNESSES RANGED FROM .276 TO .295 INCHES. COMPANY INTEGRITY AND CORROSION PERSONNEL CONDUCTED INTERNAL VISUAL EXAMINATIONS OF PIPE SECTIONS REMOVED BOTH UPSTREAM AND DOWNSTREAM OF THE LEAK LOCATION. INTERNAL CORROSION WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE LEAK CAUSE. BACTERIAL LAB TESTS WERE PERFORMED. THE TEST RESULTS RECEIVED BACK BY THE COMPANY ON JULY 24, 2023. TESTING SHOWED THAT THE INTERNAL CORROSION WAS DUE TO SULFATE AND ACID PRODUCING BACTERIA. TO DETER REOCCURRENCE, THE COMPANY WILL BE INJECTING A CORROSION INHIBITOR, AS WELL AS ADDING COUPON MONITORING.

NAME: TALLGRASS MIDSTREAM LLC
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: PIPELINE MATERIAL IS POLYETHENE (PE)
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: ON MARCH 28, 2023, AT 12:40 MOUNTAIN TIME, TALLGRASS RECEIVED NOTIFICATION FROM A THIRD-PARTY LANDOWNER REGARDING A POTENTIAL PIPELINE LEAK ON A TYPE R GATHERING LINE. COMPANY PERSONNEL WERE DEPLOYED TO INVESTIGATE AND SHUT IN THE AFFECTED PIPELINE SEGMENT. ON MARCH 29, 2023, TALLGRASS REASONABLY BELIEVED THAT THE VOLUME OF THE GAS RELEASED EXCEEDED THE 3 MILLION CUBIC FEET THRESHOLD AND SUBSEQUENTLY, TELEPHONICALLY NOTIFIED THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC). THE INITIAL NRC REPORT HAD THE INCORRECT UNIT FOR THE VOLUME NOTED; THE VOLUME WAS REPORTED IN CUBIC FEET, NOT IN THE MILLION CUBIC FEET. A CORRECTION WAS MADE TO THE INITIAL NRC ON MARCH 30, 2023, AND THE REVISED VOLUME CONTAINED HEREIN WAS REPORTED ON MARCH 31, 2023.     INITIALLY, THE PIPELINE WAS REPAIRED VIA CUTOUT AND REPLACEMENT AND PLACED BACK IN OPERATION ON MARCH 31, 2023. HOWEVER, OUT OF AN ABUNDANCE OF CAUTION, TALLGRASS TOOK THE PIPE SEGMENT BACK OUT OF SERVICE UNTIL IT CAN EVALUATE THE CAUSE OF THE RUPTURE. TALLGRASS CUTOUT A PORTION OF THE PIPE NEAR THE RUPTURE AND WILL BE SUBMITTING IT FOR TESTING.    1/23/2024 UPDATE  PART A.4 WAS UPDATED; THE ORIGINAL TIME REPORTED, 03/29/2023 12:40 MT, WAS WHEN CONFIRMED DISCOVERY OCCURRED   PART C, QUESTIONS 3I, 3J, AND 3K WERE UPDATED BASED ON THE MATERIALS INVESTIGATION REPORT WHICH STATED THE PIPELINE WAS "6" IPS SCH 40 DRISCOPIPE 8600 INDUSTRIAL PIPE PE3406/PE3408 P2 8 12 10 A2".  PART C, QUESTION 4 WAS UPDATED WITH CORRECT YEAR OF INSTALLATION.  PART E QUESTIONS 7 & 8 WERE CLARIFIED THAT THE PIPELINE MATERIAL WAS POLYETHYLENE  PART G APPARENT CAUSE UPDATED TO G6 EQUIPMENT FAILURE   PART H UPDATE: THE MATERIALS INVESTIGATION REPORT OF THE PIPE SENT FOR ANALYSIS STATED THAT THE HOOP STRENGTH, INNER-WALL OXIDATIVE-INDUCTION VALUES, AND INNER-WALL CARBONYL INDEXES OF THE SAMPLE INDICATED THERE WAS NOT A MATERIAL DEFECT WITH THE PIPELINE.  THE PIPELINE MOST LIKELY FAILED DUE TO OVERPRESSURE EVENT.   PRESSURE DATA AVAILABLE FOR THE SYSTEM INDICATES THE PIPELINE NORMALLY OPERATES AT APPROXIMATELY 30-100 PSIG.  A PRESSURE TRANSMITTER IN THE VICINITY RECORDED APPROXIMATELY 208 PSIG DUE TO A WELL COMING ONLINE AND A PRESSURE REGULATOR FAILING. (   THE OVERPRESSURE EVENT WAS MOST LIKELY CAUSED BY A PRESSURE REGULATOR MALFUNCTION AT ONE OF THE NEARBY WELLS SUPPLYING GAS TO THE PIPELINE. TO PREVENT SIMILAR EVENTS FROM OCCURRING IN THE FUTURE, TALLGRASS IS TAKING THE FOLLOWING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS:  1. INSPECT OVERPRESSURE PREVENTION EQUIPMENT AT LEAST ONCE EACH CALENDAR YEAR, NOT TO EXCEED 15 MONTHS.

THE PIPELINE WAS ISOLATED THEN DEPRESSURIZED. AT 11:28 AM MST, ENTERPRISE NOTIFIED NMPRC OF THE LEAK AS IT MET THE STATE REPORTING CRITERIA. ON 3-1-2023 AT 2:05 PM MST, AFTER REVIEWING MEASUREMENT DATA, ENTERPRISE DETERMINED THE EVENT MET INCIDENT REPORTING CRITERIA BASED ON THE EXCEEDANCE OF 3 MMSCF OF GAS RELEASED.  ADDITIONALLY, MEASUREMENT DATA INDICATED THE RELEASE INITIATED ON 2-27-2023 AT 10:30 AM MST. THE INITIAL NRC REPORT #1361189 WAS MADE ON 3-1-2023 AT 2:09 PM MST.      A LABORATORY DETERMINED THAT THE PIPELINE RUPTURE OCCURRED AT APPROXIMATELY THE 6:00 O'CLOCK ORIENTATION DUE TO INTERNAL CORROSION.

NAME: DOMINION ENERGY OHIO
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: GATHERING LINE WITH NO END FACILITIES TO ACCOMMODATE INTERNAL INSPECTION.
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: YES, SPECIFY INVESTIGATION RESULT(S): (SELECT ALL THAT APPLY)
NARRATIVE: AFTER RECOGNITION OF A DROP IN PRESSURE ON LINE 6251 BY LOCAL OPERATOR PERSONNEL, THE LOCAL PERSONNEL PERFORMED IMMEDIATE FIELD INVESTIGATION TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC AREA OF RELEASE.  AT APPROXIMATELY 12:15 AM, LOCAL PERSONNEL IDENTIFIED THE LOCATION OF THE RELEASE, WHICH IS IN A REMOTE AND UNPOPULATED AREA.  COMPLIANCE PERSONNEL WERE NOTIFIED AT APPROXIMATELY 12:40AM; REPORTING TO STATE AND NRC OCCURRED WITHIN ONE HOUR.    LOCAL PERSONNEL ALSO NOTED PIPELINE FLUID RELEASE AND TOOK IMMEDIATE STEPS TO ADDRESS.    FOLLOWING RELEASE, LOCAL OPERATIONS PERSONNEL UTILIZED VALVES TO CONTROL RELEASE OF GAS PARTIALLY AND USED STOPPLE FITTINGS TO SHUT IN THE RELEASE COMPLETELY.  A SECOND LEAK WAS NOTED IN THE SAME VICINITY OF THE ORIGINAL RELEASE AND IT IS SUSPECTED THAT BOTH RELEASES OCCURRED SIMULTANEOUSLY, AS PART OF THE SAME INCIDENT.     GAS LOSS REPORTED IN THE INITIAL REPORT ACCOUNTS FOR GAS RELEASED FROM RUPTURE UNTIL INITIAL VALVE CLOSURE, APPROXIMATELY 2.5 HOURS.  GAS CONTINUED TO RELEASE AT A LOWER LEVEL UNTIL STOPPLES WERE USED TO ISOLATE THE LEAK FULLY.  THE SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL GAS LOSS INFORMATION TO ACCOUNT FOR GAS RELEASED BETWEEN INITIAL VALVE CLOSURE AND FULL ISOLATION USING STOPPLE FITTINGS.    A CAUSE INVESTIGATION IS ONGOING AND A PROJECT TO REPAIR THE LINE IS UNDERWAY.    SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: BECAUSE BOTH THE INITIAL LEAK/RUPTURE AND THE SECOND LEAK WERE RELATIVELY CLOSE IN GEOGRAPHY, DEO INITIALLY BELIEVED THAT BOTH LEAKS OCCURRED SIMULTANEOUSLY.  THE SECOND LEAK WAS DISCOVERED WHEN EMPLOYEES WERE WALKING THE LINE IN THE AREA IN PREPARATION FOR THE REPAIR WORK AND SMELLED AN ODOR OF GAS.    HOWEVER, UPON EXCAVATION, PERSONNEL ON SITE NOTED A DISCOLORATION OF THE SOIL SURROUNDING THE SECOND LEAK, WHICH SUGGESTS THAT WHAT DEO IS CALLING THE SECOND LEAK MAY HAVE OCCURRED AT SOME TIME PRIOR TO THE INITIAL LEAK/RUPTURE. AS THE INVESTIGATION IS STILL UNDERWAY, ANY CONCLUSIONS AS TO THE CAUSE FOR THE INITIAL RUPTURE AND THE CAUSE AND TIMING FOR THE SECOND LEAK ARE UNDETERMINED AT THIS TIME.  DEO WILL SUPPLEMENT THIS INFORMATION IN A FUTURE SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT.    5/16/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: LAB EXAMINATION IS BEING SCHEDULED AND DEO WILL SUPPLEMENT THIS REPORT ONCE IT IS COMPLETED.    6/8/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: LAB EXAMINATION IS SCHEDULED FOR JUNE 26 AND 27, 2023. DEO WILL SUPPLEMENT THIS REPORT ONCE IT IS COMPLETED.    7/10/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: LAB EXAMINATION HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND DEO IS AWAITING A FINAL REPORT ON RESULTS.  ONCE REPORT IS RECEIVED AND REVIEWED, THIS REPORT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH CAUSAL INFORMATION.    8/7/2023 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: WAITING ON THE REPORT TO BE RECEIVED AND REVIEWED, THIS REPORT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH CAUSAL INFORMATION.     8/30/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: REPORT FINDINGS BEING REVIEWED BY RCA/SME TEAM FOR ADDITIONAL ANALYSIS PRIOR TO FINALIZING.    10/2/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: REVIEW COMPLETE. FINALIZING REPORT BASED ON SME INPUT.     10/30/23 - FINAL REPORT COMPLETE.     211/9/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: DUE TO THE LINE NOT BEING PLACED BACK INTO SERVICE YET, DEO WILL RESUME SUPPLEMENTAL REPORTING UNTIL APPROPRIATE ACTIONS TO MITIGATE REPEAT INCIDENTS ARE PUT INTO PLACE. DEO IS CURRENTLY REVIEWING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS AND BUDGET NEEDS FOR IMPLEMENTATION.    12/21/23 SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT UPDATE: NO CHANGE IN STATUS, DEO STILL REVIEWING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS AND BUDGETING NEEDS TO BRING LINE BACK INTO SERVICE.

CAUSE_DETAILS: DAMAGE BY OPERATOR OR OPERATOR'S CONTRACTOR NOT RELATED TO EXCAVATION AND NOT DUE TO MOTORIZED VEHICLE/EQUIPMENT DAMAGE
OPERATION_TYPE: DAMAGE BY OPERATOR OR OPERATOR'S CONTRACTOR NOT RELATED TO EXCAVATION AND NOT DUE TO MOTORIZED VEHICLE/EQUIPMENT DAMAGE
NARRATIVE: ON JANUARY 31, 2023, AT APPROXIMATELY 11:52 AM, NEXUS INTEGRITY MANAGEMENT, LLC ("NEXUS") WAS IN THE PROCESS OF INSTALLING TEST LEADS FROM AN ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS ("ENTERPRISE") PIPELINE TO A TARGA PIPELINE THAT WAS LOCATED WITHIN THE SAME RIGHT-OF-WAY. DURING THE WORK ACTIVITIES AN INCIDENT OCCURRED RESULTING IN ONE FATALITY OF A NEXUS EMPLOYEE AND INJURING TWO OTHER NEXUS EMPLOYEES. TARGA'S PIPELINE WAS DAMAGED DURING THE EVENT. ONE TARGA EMPLOYEE AND ONE ENTERPRISE EMPLOYEE WERE ON LOCATION WHEN THE EVENT OCCURRED.    NEXUS WAS HIRED TO INSTALL TEST LEADS CONNECTING TWO ENTERPRISE PIPELINES TO TWO TARGA PIPELINES (ONE EIGHT-INCH PIPELINE AND ONE FOUR-INCH PIPELINE) WITHIN A RIGHT-OF-WAY LOCATED AT 28.736804, -99.008283 AFTER TARGA IDENTIFIED STRAY CURRENT NORTH OF THE FOUR-INCH PIPELINE DURING A CATHODIC PROTECTION SURVEY. TARGA ACQUIRED BOTH PIPELINES IN APRIL OF 2022 AND THE PRIOR OPERATOR LISTED THE PIPELINE MATERIAL FOR BOTH PIPELINES AS STEEL IN ITS GIS DATA THAT WAS PROVIDED TO TARGA.   PRIOR TO STARTING PROJECT WORK, NEXUS SUBMITTED A LINE LOCATING REQUEST WITH 811 (TICKET #2352321781). PROJECT WORK BEGAN ON JANUARY 30, 2023 AT THE LOCATION OF THE INCIDENT. ON THAT DAY, NEXUS HYDRO-VACUUM EXCAVATED 12" X 12" HOLES TO POSITIVELY IDENTIFY BOTH ENTERPRISE AND BOTH TARGA PIPELINES. NEXUS NEXT WORKED ON THE ENTERPRISE PIPELINES.   ON JANUARY 31, 2023, AT THE SAME LOCATION, NEXUS PLANNED TO INSTALL A TEST LEAD WIRE TO TARGA'S FOUR-INCH PIPELINE THROUGH THE 12" X 12" HOLE CREATED ON JANUARY 30, 2023. NEXUS PLANNED TO SAND COATING FROM THE PIPELINE USING A PNEUMATIC SANDER ATTACHED TO AN EXTENSION DEVICE, AND THEN, TO CAD-WELD A TEST LEAD WIRE TO THE TOP OF THE PIPE. BASED ON THE GIS DATA ACQUIRED FROM THE PRIOR OPERATOR, VISUAL INSPECTION OF THE PIPELINE, AND OTHER TESTING, TARGA PERSONNEL CONCLUDED THAT THE PIPELINE WAS STEEL COATED IN FUSION BONDED EPOXY, WHICH IS SIMILAR IN COLOR TO THE MANUFACTURED COLOR OF FIBERSPAR OUTER JACKET AND RESEMBLES FBE COATING. NEXUS SANDED ON THE PIPELINE FOR APPROXIMATELY AN HOUR AND THEN NEXUS INFORMED TARGA THAT IT WAS GOING TO FURTHER EXCAVATE BY HYDROVAC TO GAIN BETTER ACCESS TO THE PIPELINE. AFTER THE INCIDENT, NEXUS INFORMED TARGA THAT IT HAD RETURNED TO SANDING THE PIPELINE AND THE RELEASE OCCURRED.   TARGA'S POST-INCIDENT INVESTIGATION DETERMINED: THE FOUR-INCH PIPELINE WAS FIBERSPAR (COMPOSITE); THE OUTER COLOR OF THE PIPELINE WAS SIMILAR TO FUSION BONDED EPOXY; THE PIPELINE WAS NOT INSTALLED WITH A TRACER WIRE; THE GIS DATA FROM THE PRIOR OPERATOR HAD NOT BEEN UPDATED AS TO THE PIPELINE MATERIAL; NEXUS DID NOT USE ANY EQUIPMENT, TOOLS, PROCEDURES, OR OTHER METHOD TO VERIFY THE PIPELINE COMPOSITION BEFORE STARTING WORK; AND NEXUS SANDED ON THE PIPELINE FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR AND CONTINUED SANDING WITHOUT EXCAVATING FOR BETTER ACCESS TO THE PIPELINE.

INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE OPERATOR DID NOT FIND THAT AN INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTROLLER(S) ACTIONS OR CONTROL ROOM ISSUES WAS NECESSARY DUE TO: (PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION FOR WHY THE OPERATOR DID NOT INVESTIGATE)
INVESTIGATION_STATUS_DETAILS: PERSONNEL WERE ON SITE AND CONTROLLERS WERE NOT INVOLVED.
CAUSE: MATERIAL FAILURE OF PIPE OR WELD
OTHER_FACTOR_DETAILS: HYDRATE DISLODGED AND SPLIT THE PIPE OPEN
ADDITIONAL_OTHER_DETAILS: HYDRATE DISLODGED AND SPLIT THE PIPE OPEN
NARRATIVE: THE PIPELINE OPERATOR WAS BEGINNING TO START AND LOAD TWO COMPRESSORS THAT HAD BEEN OFFLINE. THE COMPRESSORS WERE UNABLE TO LOAD AND TRIPPED ON HIGH DISCHARGE PRESSURE.  DURING THIS PROCESS AND TROUBLESHOOTING A HYDRATE INSIDE THE DISCHARGE HEADER CAME LOOSE AND TRAVELED THROUGH THE PIPING UNTIL IT STRUCK NEAR AN ISOLATION VALVE WHERE THE RUPTURE OCCURRED IN THE PIPE.  THE FACILITY WAS EMERGENCY SHUT DOWN (ESD'S) AND EMPLOYEES MOVED TO THE MUSTER POINT.  ONE EMPLOYEE WAS CHECKED OUT BY EMS BUT THERE WERE NO INJURIES.   THE PIPE HAD BEEN SPLIT OPEN LONGITUDINALLY BY THE HYDRATE.

NAME: THUNDER CREEK GAS SERVICES, LLC
SYSTEM_PART_INVOLVED: ONSHORE COMPRESSOR STATION EQUIPMENT AND PIPING
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
HOW_EXTINGUISHED_OTHER_DETAIL: 3 FLAMES WERE ALLOWED TO BURN OUT AND THE LAST SMALL FLAME WAS PUT OUT WITH A FIRE EXTINGUISHER.
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NF_EXTREME_WEATHER_DETAILS: ARCTIC COLD BLAST CAUSED EXTREME TEMPERATURES IN THE REGION.
NARRATIVE: ON DEC 23, 2022 AT 20:31, A FIRE WAS DETECTED ON THE LOW PRESSURE C-2704 SCREW COMPRESSOR UNIT AT THE CROSSBOW GATHERING COMPRESSOR STATION BY LOCAL LEL/FIRE MONITORING DEVICES AND ONSITE OPERATORS. THE LOCAL LEL MONITOR DETECTED FLAMMABLE NATURAL GAS, ALARMED AND BOTH THE LEL AND FIRE EYE SHUTDOWN THE UNIT (E.G. ESD). TWO OPERATORS (INCLUDES CONTRACT OPERATOR) WERE ONSITE AND NOTICED THE FIRE WITHIN THE COMPRESSOR BUILDING AND ONE OF THE OPERATORS HIT THE EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN (ESD) FOR THE SITE. THE OPERATORS SAFELY EVACUATED SITE TO A SAFE MUSTER POINT. AT APPROXIMATELY 20:36, SUPERVISORS/MANAGEMENT AND FIRST RESPONDERS WERE NOTIFIED OF THE EVENTS. THE THUNDER CREEK GAS SERVICE (TCGS) OPERATOR ONSITE SERVED AS INCIDENT COMMAND (IC) UNTIL THE CAMPBELL COUNTY FIRE DEPARTMENT AND TCGS FIELD MANAGEMENT ARRIVED ONSITE AT 21:23 AND 21:28, RESPECTIVELY. THE IC TEAM DETERMINED THAT THE TCGS PERSONNEL COULD SAFELY ENTER THE LOCATION TO FURTHER ISOLATE THE UNIT TO STARVE THE SMALL RESIDUAL FLAMES OF FLAMMABLE GAS. THE TCGS TEAM USED A FIRE EXTINGUISHER TO SAFELY PUT OUT A SMALL FLAME. THE CAMPBELL COUNTY FIRE DEPARTMENT DETERMINED THAT NO FURTHER ASSISTANCE OR OVERSIGHT WAS NEEDED AND WAS RELEASED AT 22:15. THE TCGS SAFETY REPRESENTATIVE ARRIVED ONSITE AT 22:58 AND ASSISTED WITH A COMPLETE SITE WALKDOWN TO ENSURE SAFETY WITH TCGS PERSONNEL. THIS WALKDOWN INCLUDED ASSESSING ALL OTHER COMPRESSOR PACKAGES ONSITE TO DETERMINE IF THEY WERE SAFE FOR OPERATION.     THE PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATION INDICATES THAT THERE WAS A LIKELY FAILURE IN A PIPING COMPONENT DUE TO A FREEZE IN THE DRAIN LINE UNDER THE SUCTION SCRUBBER TO THE SCREW COMPRESSOR PACKAGE. OPERATING DATA INDICATES THAT UNIT AND COMPONENTS DID NOT EXCEED MAOP/MAWP. THE SUSPECTED FAILURE RESULTED IN A GAS LEAK WITHIN THE BUILDING AND THE LIKELY IGNITION SOURCE WAS THE TURBO ON THE ENGINE. AT THE TIME OF INCIDENT, THIS AREA WAS OPERATING AT ABOUT 15 PSIG OF PRESSURE. THE FIRE WAS CONFINED WITHIN THE SMALL BUILDING. THE CAUSE OF THE FREEZE WAS LIKELY DUE TO THE EXTREME WEATHER EVENTS EXPERIENCED IN THE REGION AT THE TIME. THIS STATION HAD ENCOUNTERED SIGNIFICANT DOWNTIME DUE TO LOW GAS VOLUMES FROM THE LOCAL PRODUCTION AREA. DURING THAT DOWNTIME, THE AMBIENT TEMPERATURE WAS SIGNIFICANTLY BELOW ZERO.     IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT EACH COMPRESSOR PACKAGE HAS AN INDIVIDUAL BUILDING. THIS INCIDENT DID NOT IMPACT OTHER UNITS, EQUIPMENT, OR PIPING OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. AN INVESTIGATION AND ASSESSMENT TEAM WENT INTO THE UNIT IN THE FOLLOWING DAYS AFTER THE FIRE AND STARTED TO ASSESS ROOT CAUSE AND THE EXTENT OF DAMAGES. DURING THAT PROCESS, THE TEAM REALIZED THAT A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT WAS DAMAGED AND WOULD NEED REPLACEMENT. ALSO, SOME PIPING COMPONENTS, DEVICES, AND BUILDING INSULATION/PANELS WOULD REQUIRE REPLACEMENT. ONCE THE TEAM DETERMINED THAT THE COST WOULD EXCEED THE "INCIDENT REPORTING" THRESHOLD, AN IMMEDIATE NOTIFICATION WAS MADE TO THE NRC, WITH A 48-HOUR FOLLOW-UP REPORT. TCGS PERSONNEL ALSO COMMUNICATED WITH THE WYOMING DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (WDEQ) AND THE WYOMING PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION.

NARRATIVE: ON DECEMBER 21, 2022, A ONEOK EMPLOYEE WAS CONDUCTING A START-UP OF COMPRESSOR UNIT 8903 AT WARD COMPRESSOR STATION.  THE EMPLOYEE DID NOT FOLLOW THE PROPER START-UP PROCEDURE FOR THE COMPRESSOR RESULTING IN AN OVERPRESSURE OF THE COMPRESSOR PIPING AND SUBSEQUENT RUPTURE WITH IGNITION.

NAME: ENERGY TRANSFER COMPANY
ACCIDENT_IDENTIFIER: GROUND PATROL BY OPERATOR OR ITS CONTRACTOR
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: DEAD LEG
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: ON NOVEMBER 10, 2022, AT APPROXIMATELY 1:20 PM, ENERGY TRANSFER CONTRACTOR PERSONNEL IDENTIFIED A LEAK IN THE PIPELINE RIGHT-OF-WAY ON THE G7LT HP 6-INCH PIPELINE. THIS PIPELINE IS A REPORTING ONLY REGULATED TYPE R GAS GATHERING LINE IN A RURAL AREA LOCATED IN WEBB COUNTY, APPROXIMATELY 36 MILES NORTH OF LAREDO, TX. OPERATIONS PROCEEDED WITH LINE ISOLATION AND PIPELINE PIGGING PROCEDURES FOR DEWATERING THE LINE. THE UPSTREAM VALVE AND DOWNSTREAM VALVE WERE LOCKED OUT AND TAGGED OUT AT 1:36 PM. TEMPORARY REPAIRS WERE MADE, AND LINE WAS PUT BACK IN SERVICE AS OF 3:12 PM ON NOVEMBER 10, 2022.     ON DECEMBER 13, 2022, A STOPPLE WAS INSTALLED IN ORDER TO HANG A VALVE SETTING AND THE DEAD LEG WAS REMOVED. INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE APPARENT CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT WAS DUE TO INTERNAL CORROSION (MIC). TO PREVENT REOCCURRENCE, 130 FT OF DEAD LEG PIPING WAS REMOVED.    THIS FACILITY IS UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE TEXAS RAILROAD COMMISSION. ON NOVEMBER 10, 2022, THIS INCIDENT WAS TELEPHONICALLY REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC) AT 2:18 PM DUE TO COST OF PROPERTY DAMAGE AND REPAIR EXCEEDING THE $129,300 REPORTING CRITERIA. A COURTESY CALL WAS ALSO MADE TO THE TEXAS RAILROAD COMMISSION AT 2:24 PM.

NARRATIVE: CONTROLLER NOTICED AN ALARM ON STATION PIPING.  DISPATCHED FIELD PERSONNEL TO SCENE TO CHECK OUT ALARM.  IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT A 1/2" SENSING LINE NIPPLE ON THE STATION RECYCLE LINE HAD CRACKED OUT AND WAS VENTING GAS.  LINE WAS ISOLATED AND 1/2" NIPPLE WAS REPLACED WITH AN EXTRA, EXTRA HEAVY NIPPLE AND LINE WAS PLACED BACK IN SERVICE.  A VIBRATION STUDY WAS DONE ON THE PIPING AND FOUND TO BE WITHIN RECOMMENDED GUIDELINES AND SPECIFICATIONS.  THE CAUSE OF THE CRACK IS UNKNOWN.  THIS STATION WAS A PREVIOUSLY UNREGULATED TYPE R GATHERING FACILITY.

NAME: ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING LLC
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE

INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: PE PIPELINE
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
ROOT_CAUSE_TYPE: EXCAVATOR FAILED TO MAINTAIN CLEARANCE AFTER VERIFYING MARKS
NARRATIVE: ON 8-17-2022 AT 14:24 CST, AN ENTERPRISE PERSONNEL SAW AND RESPONDED TO A FIRE NEAR AN ENTERPRISE PIPELINE. AT 14:30, ENTERPRISE ARRIVED AT THE EVENT AND DETERMINED THAT ENTERPRISE PIPELINE WAS AFFECTED BY THE FIRE. AT 14:45 AND 14.55, ENTERPRISE ISOLATED THE PIPELINE.  AT 16:55, ENTERPRISE DETERMINED THAT THE EVENT WOULD MEET THE DEFINITION OF AN INCIDENT BASED ON ANTICIPATED COSTS. THE NRC AND TXRRC WERE NOTIFIED OF THE EVENT BY ENTERPRISE AT 17:13 AND 17:09,RESPECTIVELY. ON 8-17-2022 AT 19:00, THE FIRE SELF-EXTINGUISHED.     THERE WAS NON-OPERATOR PROPERTY DAMAGE OF EQUIPMENT FROM THIS EVENT, HOWEVER, THIS COST IS NOT KNOWN TO ENTERPRISE.

NAME: HILCORP ENERGY COMPANY
SYSTEM_PART_INVOLVED: ONSHORE COMPRESSOR STATION EQUIPMENT AND PIPING
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INCIDENT_AREA_SUBTYPE: TYPICAL ABOVEGROUND FACILITY PIPING OR APPURTENANCE
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
OPERATION_RELATED_DETAILS: IT IS SUSPECTED THAT THE GASKET DID NOT SEAL PROPERLY
NARRATIVE: AN HEC OPERATED COMPRESSOR, THAT IS CONNECTED TO AN ENTERPRISE TYPE R GATHERING LINE. THE COMPRESSOR IS LOCATED IN A RURAL AREA. IT HAD RECENTLY UNDERGONE MAINTENANCE. AT THE TIME OF MAINTENANCE CRUSH O-RINGS HAD BEEN REPLACED ON THE 2801 AJAX COMPRESSOR VALVE COVER. THE COMPRESSOR WAS RETURNED TO SERVICE AFTER MAINTENANCE WAS COMPLETED. IT IS SUSPECTED THAT THE GASKET DID NOT SEAL PROPERLY AFTER INSTALLATION. THE LEAK GREW WORSE OVER A PERIOD OF DAYS, UNTIL A REGULARLY SCHEDULED METHANE LEAK DETECTION FLY OVER NOTIFIED HEC OF A POTENTIAL LEAK IN THE AREA. ONCE SUPERVISORS WERE MADE AWARE OF THE POTENTIAL LEAK, FIELD PERSONNEL WERE DISPATCHED TO THE AREA TO INVESTIGATE. THE LEAK WAS FOUND AND REPAIRED BY RE-TORQUEING THE VALVE COVER IN PLACE. SCADA DATA WAS REVIEWED AND THE CORRECT CALCULATIONS WERE RUN TO ESTIMATE THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF UNINTENTIONAL GAS LOST OVER A PERIOD OF 6 DAYS. ONCE CALCULATIONS WERE RUN AND THE UNINTENTIONAL GAS LOST MET THE CRITERIA OF 191.3 INCIDENT (1)(III) AN IMMEDIATE NOTIFICATION TO THE NRC WAS MADE.

NAME: ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING LLC
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
RELEASE_TYPE_DETAILS: FAILURE OF THE FUSION BUTT-WELD BETWEEN TWO PE PIPES
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: POLY PIPE IS NOT PRACTICAL FOR ILI INSPECTION
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
CAUSE: MATERIAL FAILURE OF PIPE OR WELD
OTHER_FACTOR_DETAILS: FAILURE OF THE FUSION BUTT-WELD BETWEEN TWO PE PIPES
ADDITIONAL_OTHER_DETAILS: FAILURE OF THE FUSION BUTT-WELD BETWEEN TWO PE PIPES
NARRATIVE: ON MAY 25, 2022, AT 20:30 CDST PL CONTROL REQUESTED OPERATIONS INVESTIGATE A POSSIBLE LEAK ON THE GAS GATHERING PIPELINE PT-1-6. AT 21:00 A PIPELINE TECHNICIAN ARRIVED AND IDENTIFIED A LEAK ORIGINATING FROM CASING VENTS ON EITHER SIDE OF STATE HIGHWAY 350. THE TECHNICIAN ISOLATED THE LINE SEGMENT BY 21:30.     AT 23:42, ENTERPRISE NOTIFIED THE LOCAL POLICE TO CLOSE HIGHWAY 350. THE ROAD CLOSURE WAS DEEMED A SIGNIFICANT EVENT, AS A RESULT, NOTIFICATIONS WERE MADE TO NRC (#1337023 @ 00:14; #1337138 @ 48HRS) AND THE TRRC (#2623 @ 00:21). THE ROAD REOPENED ON MAY 26 AT 09:00.     THE FAILURE SEGMENT WAS CUT OUT AND REPLACED ON JUNE 15, 2022 AND PLACED BACK IN-SERVICE.      A VISUAL EXAMINATION OF THE PIPE SEGMENT DETERMINED THAT THE FUSION BUTTWELD FAILED BETWEEN TWO PE PIPES FROM THE INSTALLATION OF THE PIPELINE.

NAME: ENABLE MIDSTREAM PARTNERS, LP
STATUS_WHEN_IDENTIFIED: NORMAL OPERATION, INCLUDES PAUSES DURING MAINTENANCE
INTERNAL_INSPECTION_DETAILS: NO ACCESS TO LAUNCH TOOL
INVESTIGATION_STATUS: NO, THE FACILITY WAS NOT MONITORED BY A CONTROLLER(S) AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT
NARRATIVE: ON 5/17/2022,  AT APPROXIMATELY 19:00, A PRODUCER CONTACTED ENABLE PIPELINE TECHNICIAN CONCERNING A SMALL GAS IMBALANCE BETWEEN HIS METER AND ETC METER. THE METER WAS CHECKED ON THE MORNING OF 5/18/22, BUT NO MEASUREMENT EQUIPMENT ISSUES WERE IDENTIFIED.  PIPELINE TECHNICIAN THEN INVESTIGATED BY PATROLLING THE AO-70 4-INCH PIPELINE RIGHT OF WAY AND DISCOVERED A LEAK AT APPROXIMATELY 11:15.  PIPELINE WAS SHUT IN IMMEDIATELY BY MANUALLY CLOSING THE UPSTREAM AND DOWNSTREAM VALVES AT 11:30 AND 11:50. THE PIPELINE WAS UNCOVERED, AND A SMALL PINHOLE LEAK, APPROXIMATELY 100 THOUSANDTHS IN SIZE, WAS REPAIRED BY INSTALLING A CLAMP. THE PIPELINE WAS RESTARTED AT 19:00 ON 5/18/2022 AND PATROLLED AGAIN, NO ADDITIONAL LEAKS WERE IDENTIFIED.    CLEANUP REMEDIATION BEGAN ON 5/18/2022, ESTIMATED COSTS WERE WELL BELOW THE REPORTING THRESHOLD.  THE COST OF REMEDIATION THEN EXCEEDED THE $122,000 THRESHOLD ON 6/1/2022 AND THE INCIDENT WAS CLASSIFIED AS REPORTABLE AT THAT TIME. NOTIFICATION TO TEXAS RAILROAD COMMISSION OIL & GAS DIVISION WAS PREVIOUSLY MADE ON 5/18/2022 REGARDING THE CONDENSATE SPILL (ENVIRONMENTAL). TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATIONS WERE MADE TO NRC AND TEXAS RAILROAD COMMISSION PIPELINE SAFETY ON 6/1/2022 WHEN THE PIPELINE SAFETY INCIDENT (191.3) CRITERIA WAS MET. REMEDIATION HAS BEEN COMPLETED.    AFTER ET MET WITH PHMSA/PIERZINA ON 9/13/22, INCIDENT REPORT DATES AND TIMES WERE REVISED FOR THE A.4 AND A.13 ENTRIES, PER MR. PIERZINA' S INSTRUCTIONS. THESE REVISIONS PUSHED THE 'EARLIEST LOCAL TIME (24-HR CLOCK) AND DATE AN INCIDENT REPORTING CRITERIA WAS MET' BACK TO 5/17/22, BEFORE THE COST CRITERIA WAS MET.
